page.title: 15THE OUSE AND LAIRO WATER
page.content: {The Ouse}is a long arm of water which was formed when the{coastline}broke and the water rushed in.It is{tidal}so it drains of water when the tide goes out.People dig in the sand for {cockles}.Around the mouth of the{Ouse there are a few rocks where{mussels grow.Mussels are very difficult to pull off the rock because they attach themselves by a bundle of short threads. LAIRO WATER Near by,lies{Lairo Water}.It is completely closed off from the sea by a strip of land.This is called an {"ayre." Swans}nest here nearly every year.{Long Tailed}ducks which are winter visitors have been seen,so have{Tufted }ducks.The water there is salt water,not fresh water.{Lairo {Water}is not very deep.
